title: Do you think Jang Wonyoung deserved to be the center of Iz*one (just based off produce 48)? - Quora

response.answer_text: When they first debuted, I’d have said yes. I didn’t like Wonyoung as a center, mainly because of why she was made center. It’s pretty obvious that the votes were rigged because they didn’t want a Japanese trainee to place first, and that the many votes Wonyoung gained were from perverts after her ‘Side to Side’ performance (it still makes me cringe. She was a minor and dancing an extremely sexual dance with the most revealing clothes) but I was still curious to see how she did as the center. Iz*one are an amazing group full of wonderful performers, and all of them outshined Wonyoung when the group first debuted. She’s definitely improved over the years. Wonyoung has natural charisma and is beautiful and talented, but she lacks variety. I’d prefer Sakura as the center since she suits and adapts to all of the concepts Iz*one have taken, but Wonyoung is doing an amazing job nonetheless.

Yes, definitely and personally I disagree with the arguments preferring Sakura to be the center instead of Wonyoung. As seen in PD101’s previous projects, the center position was the one with the highest number of votes and has to be a good dancer and the one who draws the attention from the crowd when dancing. It doesn’t really matter if the Center is a sub-vocalist, since both Kang Daniel and Somi were both subs. Wonyoung has this charisma that keep people’s eyes fixed on her presence and everything from her stage presence, expressions and gestures are on point. Plus, her vocals even if it has a squeaky tone to it is much better than Sakura’s. That’s all I have to say based on my personal outlook on this matter. You are more than permitted to think the opposite of my thinking if it makes you feel liberated somehow. Bye2

Personally, I don’t think Jang Wonyoung was fit for the responsibilities fit with the center of the group; however, she absolutely did a lot of hard work to get that position at such a young age. Based off what we could see off Produce 48 and the hard work that she put into the show, it was clear that she worked really hard and being center was definitely a good decision based off her work ethic. However, if being center meant being leader, Wonyoung would not fit that as well as Eunbi would. However, as the center’s job is to look pretty, represent the group and to be the main spokesperson, I think Wonyoung does a good job and definitely fits the position.

Nope. Sakura was the real center but PD 48 rigged the votes and they thought that a Japanese Idol couldn’t dominate and they picked Wonyoung. Wonyoung’s final ranking was 7 and they made it 1. Sakura’s real ranking was one. It was fishy because Chaeyeon’s final ranking was 12. Her final ranking was 3rd. Again they changed it. I think there were more Japanese members if they did not rig the votes. It isin’t Jang Wonyoung’s fault though. She isin’t popular as Sakura and Chaeyeon.
